alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 03 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall Possible East Coast Areas On Saturday... A frontal boundary will move northward into South Florida on Saturday, as a mid level trough moves eastward from the Gulf of Mexico into the Florida Peninsula. This will allow for the steering flow to become southwest over South Florida as the surface winds will remain north northeast due to high pressure over the Gulf of Mexico. This in turn will allow for a low level trough to develop over the eastern areas of South Florida. At the same time, the southwest steering flow will allow for deeper tropical moisture to work northeast from the the Florida Straits into the eastern areas of South Florida. PWAT values are forecast to increase to 2 to 2.2 inches over the eastern areas of the region which is near the maximum PWAT values for this time of year. Therefore, any showers or thunderstorms that do develop on over the eastern areas of South Florida on Saturday will be capable of producing heavy rainfall. At this time, it looks like rainfall amounts will be between 1 to 2 inches but there could be higher amounts where any showers or thunderstorm train over the same area. Will continue to monitor the latest model forecast on the potential of heavy rainfall for Saturday.
